example.eg: The teacher lined up all her students before taking them out to recess.
Please line up the pictures on the wall so they are all straight.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 对齐, 使...成一条直线

dsense.name: line [sth] up with [sth], line up [sth] with [sth]

example.eg: When using the cutter, line your paper up with the guideline.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将…与…对齐, 使…与…成一条直线

example.eg: Tomorrow, Jupiter, Saturn and Mars will line up in the evening sky.
The two holes did not line up with each other, so I could not insert the bolt.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 与…对齐, 与…成一条直线

example.eg: People lined up in front of the box office to buy tickets for the show.
I've lined up a lot of activities for us this week.
The store owner identified his assailant in a police lineup.

trans_examp.trans_cn: (警察要见证人指出谁为嫌疑犯而让数人排成的)行列

example.eg: There is a great line-up for this year's festival, including many famous stars.

trans_examp.trans_cn: （电影院﹑ 剧场等的）节目单，节目安排

example.eg: The festival's lineup will be published this week.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 计划或事情的次序, 项目安排

example.eg: The fans objected to the team's lineup; it was missing the best player!
The boy tried to gain the girl's attention with his chat-up lines.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 搭讪的话, 挑逗的话
